thread.title: NY Kids Club & NY Preschool Announces Vincent Ferrucci as New COO

author: cnbc.com
title: NY Kids Club & NY Preschool Announces Vincent Ferrucci as New COO
text:
This is a new position within NYKC and Ferrucci assumes the role immediately.
NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)-- NY Kids Club, a leading provider of premier early childhood education, camps, parties and events, along with its award-winning NY Preschool affiliate (collectively, the “Club”), today announced the appointment of Vincent Ferrucci as COO.
Mr. Ferrucci assumes the role immediately. Ferrucci was previously the Director of Sales and Field Operations since joining the company in 2017. As the newly appointed COO, Vincent will drive strategic prioritization and accountability within NY Kids Club. Ferrucci assumes the responsibility for continuing to build strong leadership teams, sales performance and NY Kids Club operations and services organizations. He is responsible for the alignment and prioritization of building company relationships and ensuring operational excellence across the company.
Mr. Ferrucci brings with him a wealth of business knowledge and vast experience in field operations. "Vincent is a seasoned and trusted leader who consistently delivers results. He is uniquely qualified to drive strategic prioritization and accountability within NY Kids Club, with a laser-focus on operational excellence," said Dana Fiser, CEO, NY Kids Club. "I have tremendous confidence in Vincent’s ability to align NYKC world-class innovation and bringing learning to life-leading operational practices that will drive and extend the next-generation of NY Kids Club market leadership."
Prior to this appointment, Ferrucci was responsible for leading the overall strategy and execution for NY Kids Club Sales. In that role, his team of employees was comprised of subject matter teaching experts and a team of Directors who help families find the fun in learning.
Ferrucci joined NY Kids Club in 2017 from Metabolic Research Center (H.D.C.T.), where as COO he expanded the business through the central part of the country with continuous revenue growth. Before MRC, he had a 20-year career at Jenny Craig, where he held a number of executive and leadership positions. While at Jenny Craig, Ferrucci was instrumental in the growth of Jenny Craig at Home and Jenny Care programs, serving as Director of North America Center services.
Ferrucci also spent 4 years at Sylvan Learning Centers in a variety of leadership roles. Continually overachieving profit margin and revenue growth targets. Ferrucci specialized in taking over Sylvan’s underperforming markets on the West Coast building them into successful profitable businesses. Ferrucci was instrumental in the company’s transition into hybrid markets in 2008 before his return to Jenny Craig.
"NY Kids Club strategy has never been more compelling, and we have won the hearts and minds of our families," said Ferrucci. "I am incredibly energized to help lead the company to its next phase of innovation and bringing learning to life, tied with operational excellence." Mr. Ferrucci will continue to report directly to Dana Fiser, CEO.
“Vincent understands global sales, go-to-market strategy, and customer satisfaction in a way that few executives can hope to. He’s got a proven track record of maximizing the growth potential of a range of businesses,” said, CEO Dana Fiser of NY Kids Club. “He’s joining an already successful, energetic team at the perfect time to spearhead sales and operational expansion.” We congratulate Vincent on his new role.
About NY Kids Club and NY Preschool
Founded in 2001 by Pam Wolf, NY Kids Club has a unique and original curricula providing children the opportunity to build confidence and express their individuality through participation in physically challenging, artistically enriching, and intellectually stimulating programs. Additionally, its affiliated programs at NY Preschool are a leading preschool choice for the years leading up to Kindergarten. NY Preschool students outperform other Kindergarteners by 75% in reading and math (results based on MAP Growth test).
In 2015, the organization received a majority investment from New Harbor Capital , a Chicago-based private equity firm to fuel its continued growth and national expansion.
